Enumeration Type Documentation

enum quickcpplib::_xxx::ensure_stores::memory_flush
strong

The kinds of cache line flushing which can be performed.

Enumerator
memory_flush_none 

No memory flushing.

memory_flush_retain 

Flush modified cache line to memory, but retain as unmodified in cache.

memory_flush_evict 

Flush modified cache line to memory, and evict completely from all caches.

44  {
45  memory_flush_none, //!< No memory flushing.
46  memory_flush_retain, //!< Flush modified cache line to memory, but retain as unmodified in cache.
47  memory_flush_evict //!< Flush modified cache line to memory, and evict completely from all caches.
48  };

size_t  bytes,
memory_flush  kind = memory_flush_none,
std::memory_order  order = std::memory_order_release 
)
inlinenoexcept
187  {
188  // I really wish this would work on a region, not globally
189  atomic_thread_fence(order);
190  // Ensure dead store elimination does not occur on our region by calling a
191  // potentially unknown external function which forces the compiler to dump
192  // out all pending writes before this call
193  detail::potentially_unknown_jump()(data, bytes);
194  if(memory_flush_none != kind)
195  {
196  // TODO FIXME We assume a 64 byte cache line, which is bold.
197  void *_data = (void *) (((uintptr_t) data) & ~63);
198  size_t _bytes = ((uintptr_t) data + bytes + 63) - ((uintptr_t) _data);
199  _bytes &= ~63;
200  memory_flush ret = detail::flush_impl()(_data, _bytes, kind);
201  return {ret, order};
202  }
203  return {kind, order};
204  }
